titleStmt.title: A model of church-government: or, The grounds of the spirituall frame and government of the house of God. Shewing, what the holy Scriptures have therein delivered; what the best Reformed Churches do practise; what the tender consciences may rest in. For the better satisfaction of such as scruple at the work of reformation, declared and appointed by severall ordinances of Parliament. / By John Dury, one of the Assembly of Divines; who hath travelled heretofore in the work of peace among the churches.
titleStmt.author: Dury, John, 1596-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.R. and E.M. for John Bellamy, and are to be sold at his shop at the three golden Lyons neer the Royall Exchange.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the three golden Lyons neer the Royall Exchange.
